2 feet of snow in some areas

The storm expected to slam the state Friday will leave 14 to 18 inches of snow across much of the state with some areas getting up to two feet, forecasters said. (12:24 p.m.)

Mayor Menino is asking a special panel he appointed to overhaul the way students are assigned to schools to delay a key vote set for Saturday. (11:46 a.m.)

T repairs cracked rail on Red Line

The Red Line resumed regular speeds this morning after crews repaired a crack found in a rail between Central Square and Harvard Square. (11:21 a.m.)

marijuana in Mass.

There are two things that can stop Patriots star Rob Gronkowski: injuries and himself. They crashed together on the floor of a Las Vegas nightclub this week.

Bias alleged in Google’s ad results

A research project concludes that searches of names more likely associated with black people often yielded ads for a criminal records search in that person’s name.
Opinion | Jeff Jacoby

The Bay State’s plan for tax giveaways for Broadway-bound shows won’t work.

British officials are studying the success of Kendall Square and the influence of MIT as they try to turn London into a global technology center.

Kudos to Dan Winslow and Gabriel Gomez, the two Republicans in this state willing to join the race for US Senate. Apparently willing, anyway.

News

Small tsunami hits Solomons

An 8.0-magnitude earthquake off the Solomon Islands generated a tsunami with waves up to about 5 feet that damaged dozens of homes and left several people missing and presumed dead in the South Pacific island chain.

Business

Saturday mail service cut

The U.S. Postal Service will stop delivering mail on Saturdays but continue to deliver packages six days a week under a plan aimed at saving about $2 billion annually.
  • poll Will you miss Saturday mail delivery?

Your Campus

MIT's Charm School evolves with new lessons

The annual Charm School at MIT teaches students etiquette for modern business encounters. Students learn how to hold a wine glass and ask for a recommendation but also how to tweet correctly and when not to text.

for $500,000
